item.title: 芝加哥因云税和房屋销售收入超预期
item.description: 今年前两个月，芝加哥的财政收入超出预期 7.2%，这要归功于对云存储和房屋销售征收的税款，这些税款的征收将帮助这个正为年度赤字而苦苦挣扎的城市。【原文：Chicago’s revenue exceeded estimates by 7.2% in the first two months of this year thanks to taxes on cloud storage and home sales, collections that will help a city that’s struggling with annual deficits.】

item.title: 关税威胁冲击生产中心后苹果股价下滑
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布对苹果公司的海外生产中心征收关税后，苹果公司在尾盘交易中下滑达 5.6%，这可能使这家 iPhone 制造商比预期更容易受到关税的影响。【原文：Apple Inc. slid as much as 5.6% in late trading after President Donald Trump announced tariffs that target its overseas production hubs, potentially making the iPhone maker more vulnerable to the levies than anticipated.】

item.title: 不列颠哥伦比亚省四年来第四次被下调信用评级
item.description: 不列颠哥伦比亚省的信用评级被 S&P 全球评级公司下调至 A+，原因是在政府支出增加的同时，移民减少和贸易不确定性对加拿大该省的经济增长造成了压力。【原文：British Columbia’s credit rating has been cut to A+ by S&P Global Ratings as lower immigration and trade uncertainty weigh on the Canadian province’s economic growth at the same time that governmental spending is increasing.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布加征关税提振避险需求，黄金上涨
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的对等关税刺激了避险需求，现货黄金走高。【原文：Spot gold advanced as Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs boost haven demand.】

item.title: Neuralink 面向全球招募脑植入研究人员
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的大脑植入公司 Neuralink 正在寻找世界各地的病人参与一种设备的研究，这种设备可以让人们用意念控制计算机。【原文：Neuralink, Elon Musk’s brain implant company, is looking for patients all over the world to participate in research on a device that allows people to use their thoughts to control computers.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒支持在通胀上行风险下维持利率不变
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，在通胀上行风险减弱之前，维持利率不变是合适的，她指出了政府政策变化、近期物价增长降温缺乏进展以及通胀预期上升等因素。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said it’s appropriate to keep interest rates unchanged until upside risks to inflation abate, pointing to government policy changes, the recent lack of progress on cooling price growth and rising inflation expectations.】

item.title: 马里奥卡丁车》促使人们对任天堂 Switch 2 播放器的销售持乐观态度
item.description: 研究公司 Omdia 周三预测，任天堂公司今年将售出 1,470 万台新款 Switch 2 视频游戏机，轻松超过八年前初代产品上市时的销量。【原文：Nintendo Co. will sell 14.7 million of the new Switch 2 video-game consoles this year, the research firm Omdia predicted Wednesday, easily exceeding the tally for the debut of the original eight years ago.】

item.title: 波动性推动加拿大 ETF 在 3 月份创下历史最高流入量
item.description: 加拿大上市的交易所交易基金在 3 月份创下了 136 亿加元（95 亿美元）的纪录，比 12 月份创下的最高纪录高出 28%。【原文：Canada-listed exchange-traded funds brought in a record C$13.6 billion ($9.5 billion) in March, beating the high set in December by 28%.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧盟必须接受多数表决权而非否决权
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）呼吁对欧盟的决策方式进行彻底改革，建议采用多数表决制，以提高欧盟的竞争力。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde called for an overhaul of how European Union decisions are taken, proposing that majority voting should be embraced to make the bloc more competitive.】

item.title: 华尔街敦促希望首次公开募股的公司在市场疲软时降低估值
item.description: 由于美国股市动荡，给首次公开募股蒙上了阴影，华尔街的一些人敦促公司降低估值，以增加成功交易的机会。【原文：As turbulent US equity markets cloud the picture for initial public offerings, some on Wall Street are urging companies to temper their valuations for a better chance of pulling off a successful deal.】

item.title: Sitetracker 委托 Evercore 探讨 10 亿美元出售事宜

item.title: 反托拉斯领导者力争保护备受瞩目的案件不受司法部削减影响
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，司法部反垄断部门的高级官员正试图阻止一项全机构范围内的重组计划破坏重大竞争案件的审理。【原文：Top officials in the Justice Department’s antitrust division are trying to blunt an agency-wide reorganization plan from derailing major competition cases, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔石油公司在加勒比水域寻找海上天然气储备
item.description: 哥伦比亚国有能源生产商 Ecopetrol SA 计划很快开始在该国加勒比海水域钻探另一口油井，以巩固其日益减少的天然气储量。【原文：Colombia’s state-owned energy producer Ecopetrol SA plans to soon start drilling another well in the nation’s Caribbean waters in a bid to shore up its declining natural gas reserves.】

item.title: WeightWatchers 正在洽谈将控制权移交给贷款人的可能性
item.description: 据知情人士透露，WW 国际公司正在与贷方商讨将部分债务转换为股权的事宜，这项交易也有可能将这家陷入困境的饮食企业的控制权移交给债权人。【原文：WW International Inc. is in discussions with lenders to swap a portion of their debt for equity in a deal that could also potentially hand control of the struggling diet business to creditors, according to people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 特朗普将在玫瑰园活动中宣布互惠互利的关税政策
item.description: 2025 年 4 月 2 日星期三，在墨西哥奇瓦瓦州华雷斯的美墨边境伊斯莱塔-萨拉戈萨国际大桥入境口岸，拖拉机拖车驶入美国。特朗普计划于 4 月 2 日下午 4 点在白宫玫瑰园举行的活动中推出对全球贸易伙伴征收关税的措施，这是他努力将制造业带回美国并重塑他长期以来斥责为不公平的世界贸易体系的核心内容。【原文：Tractor trailers cross into the US at the Ysleta-Zaragoza International Bridge port of entry, on the US-Mexico border in Juarez, Chihuahua state, Mexico, on Wednesday, April 2, 2025. Trump on April 2 plans to roll out tariffs on global trading partners during an event planned for 4 p.m. in the White House Rose Garden, the centerpiece of his effort to bring back manufacturing to the US and reshape a world trade system he has long decried as unfair.】

item.title: 近期股市反弹的背后是空头回补
item.description: 本周，由于担心贸易战和经济增长放缓，S&P 500 指数开始时每天都大幅下跌，但随后又回升，收盘时更是一路飘绿。虽然股市的走势并不总是一目了然，但这些走势背后都潜藏着一个罪魁祸首：空头回补。【原文：The S&P 500 Index has started each day this week down significantly on fears of trade wars and slowing economic growth only to recover and close well into the green. While the movements of the stock market aren’t always clear, there is a culprit lurking beneath these moves: short-covering.】

item.title: 萨默斯称特朗普关税将造成石油冲击型经济打击
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）说，特朗普政府迫在眉睫的关税上调势必会给经济带来类似石油危机的冲击，使其生产能力萎缩，从而推高物价和失业率。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said the Trump administration’s looming tariff hikes are set to impose an oil crisis-like shock to the economy that shrinks its productive capacity — boosting both prices and unemployment.】

item.title: 亚马逊将于本月发射首批 Kuiper 互联网卫星

item.title: 特朗普 1.6 万亿美元企业承诺游行：真真假假
item.description:
自特朗普当选连任总统以来，商界领袖们已承诺为美国提供至少 1.6 万亿美元的支出。如果以史为鉴，这些承诺并不会全部兑现。【原文：

Business leaders have pledged at least $1.6 trillion in US spending since Trump was elected to a second term as president. If history is any guide, not all of it will materialize.

item.title: 债券交易员希望经济衰退 股票投资者不希望
item.description: 今天是所谓的 "解放日"，预计美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将在这一天宣布一个世纪以来最大规模的贸易限制措施。该消息将在美国金融市场收盘后宣布，但显然，在我写这篇文章时，他的团队仍在制定细节。投资者已经下定了决心，债券交易似乎面临着经济衰退的重大风险，而股票交易则竭力避免这种风险。【原文：It’s so-called Liberation Day, the day when US President Donald Trump is expected to announce the most expansive trade restrictions in a century. The announcement is slated to take place after US financial markets close but, apparently, his team is still hashing out the details as I write this. Investors have already made up their minds, with bonds trading as if a recession is a major risk and stocks doing their darnedest not to price that in.】

item.title: PE 公司 Bowmark 考虑以 5 亿英镑出售 Totalmobile
item.description: 据知情人士透露，收购公司 Bowmark Capital 正在探索出售劳动力管理软件开发商 Totalmobile，交易价值可能超过 5 亿英镑（6.49 亿美元）。【原文：Buyout firm Bowmark Capital is exploring a sale of workforce management software developer Totalmobile, which could be valued at more than £500 million ($649 million) in a deal, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 亚马逊竞购 TikTok，美国销售截止日期临近
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，亚马逊公司向白宫提交了一份竞标书，希望从中国所有者手中收购社交视频应用 TikTok。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. submitted a bid to the White House to purchase the social video app TikTok from its Chinese owners, according to a person familiar with the matter.】
